Package org.webpki.util

Class Base64

java.lang.Object
org.webpki.util.Base64
public class Base64
extends Object
Encodes/decodes base64 data.

  • Constructor Details

    • Base64

      public Base64()
      Default constructor.
       encodedCharsPerRow = 76; // 76/4*3 = 57 uncoded bytes
 lineBreakOn = true;
 paddingOn = true;

    • Base64

      public Base64​(boolean linebreak)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      linebreak - whether or not the base64 encoded data should be divided into several rows. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.

    • Base64

      public Base64​(int encCharsARow)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      encCharsARow - number of encoded characters before each linebreak. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.

    • Base64

      public Base64​(int encCharsARow, boolean padding)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      encCharsARow - number of encoded characters before each linebreak. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.
      padding - whether or not the encoded base64 data should be padded at the end

  • Method Details

    • resetToDefault

      public void resetToDefault()
      Resets all settings to their default values, as specified in the default constructor

    • setEncodedCharsPerRow

      public void setEncodedCharsPerRow​(int count)
      Sets number of encoded characters before each linebreak. If count isn't divisible by 4, it will be treated as the nearest larger integer divisible by 4. Must be larger than zero and no more than 76. Default value is 76. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.
      Parameters:
      count - number of base64 characters in each row

    • setLineBreakOn

      public void setLineBreakOn​(boolean on)
      If set to true the base64 encoded data will be divided into a number of rows. Default value is true. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.
      Parameters:
      on - on/off switch for line break.

    • setPaddingOn

      public void setPaddingOn​(boolean on)
      If set to true the base64 encoded data will be padded at the end to make sure every 3 uncoded bytes corresponds to 4 encoded ones. Max. 2 padding bytes. Default value is true. Warning: Deviating from default values, might cause compatibility problems with other Base64 encoders/decoders.
      Parameters:
      on - on/off switch for padding.

    • getEncodedCharsPerRow

      public int getEncodedCharsPerRow()
      Returns number of encoded characters before each line feed.
      Returns:
      number of base64 encoded characters per row

    • getLineBreakOn

      public boolean getLineBreakOn()
      Tells you whether or not the base64 data will be divided into a number of rows.
      Returns:
      true if base64 data will include line feeds

    • getPaddingOn

      public boolean getPaddingOn()
      Tells you whether or not the base64 data will be padded to preserve the 3:4 ratio between uncoded and encoded bytes.
      Returns:
      true if base64 data will be padded

    • unicodeToByteArray

      public static byte[] unicodeToByteArray​(String unicode) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • stringToByteArray

      public static byte[] stringToByteArray​(String s) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getBinaryFromBase64Binary

      public byte[] getBinaryFromBase64Binary​(byte[] base64Ascii8Blob) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded byte array to a binary byte array. For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes.
      Parameters:
      base64Ascii8Blob - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a byte array
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data

    • getBinaryFromBase64String

      public byte[] getBinaryFromBase64String​(String base64) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded String to a binary byte array. For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes.
      Parameters:
      base64 - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a byte array
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data or if the input String contains characters other than ASCII8.

    • getStringFromBase64Binary

      public String getStringFromBase64Binary​(byte[] base64Ascii8Blob) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded byte array to a String representation of the binary data. For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes.
      Parameters:
      base64Ascii8Blob - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a String
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data.

    • getStringFromBase64String

      public String getStringFromBase64String​(String base64) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded String to a String representation of the binary data. For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes.
      Parameters:
      base64 - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a String
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data or if the input String contains characters other than ASCII8.

    • getUnicodeFromBase64Binary

      public String getUnicodeFromBase64Binary​(byte[] base64Ascii8Blob) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded byte array to a Unicode String representation of the binary data (UTF-8). For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes. Note, however, that these bytes are UTF-8 bytes and is not equal to the length of the Unicode String.
      Parameters:
      base64Ascii8Blob - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a Unicode String
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data or if there is a problem converting UTF-8 to Unicode

    • getUnicodeFromBase64String

      public String getUnicodeFromBase64String​(String base64) throws IOException
      [Decoding] Converts a base64 encoded String to a Unicode String representation of the binary data (UTF-8). For every 4 base64 bytes you'll get 3 binary bytes. Note, however, that these bytes are UTF-8 bytes and is not equal to the length of the Unicode String.
      Parameters:
      base64 - encoded data
      Returns:
      decoded data as a Unicode String
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input data isn't valid base64 data or if there is a problem converting UTF-8 to Unicode

    • getBase64BinaryFromBinary

      public byte[] getBase64BinaryFromBinary​(byte[] binaryBlob)
      [Encoding] Converts a binary byte array to a base64 encoded byte array. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes.
      Parameters:
      binaryBlob - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a byte array

    • getBase64BinaryFromString

      public byte[] getBase64BinaryFromString​(String ascii8) throws IOException
      [Encoding] Converts a String representation of a binary byte array to a base64 encoded byte array. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes.
      Parameters:
      ascii8 - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a byte array
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input String contains non-ascii8 characters.

    • getBase64BinaryFromUnicode

      public byte[] getBase64BinaryFromUnicode​(String unicode) throws IOException
      [Encoding] Converts a Unicode String representation of a binary byte array (UTF-8) to a base64 encoded byte array. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes. Note, however, that these bytes are UTF-8 bytes and is not equal to the length of the Unicode String.
      Parameters:
      unicode - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a byte array
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a problem converting Unicode to UTF-8.

    • getBase64StringFromBinary

      public String getBase64StringFromBinary​(byte[] binaryBlob)
      [Encoding] Converts a binary byte array to a base64 encoded String. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes.
      Parameters:
      binaryBlob - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a String

    • getBase64StringFromString

      public String getBase64StringFromString​(String ascii8) throws IOException
      [Encoding] Converts a String representation of a binary byte array to a base64 encoded String. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes.
      Parameters:
      ascii8 - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a String
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input String contains non-ascii8 characters.

    • getBase64StringFromUnicode

      public String getBase64StringFromUnicode​(String unicode) throws IOException
      [Encoding] Converts a Unicode String representation of a binary byte array (UTF-8) to a base64 encoded String. For every 3 binary bytes, you'll get 4 base64 bytes. Note, however, that these bytes are UTF-8 bytes and is not equal to the length of the Unicode String.
      Parameters:
      unicode - uncoded data
      Returns:
      encoded data as a String
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a problem converting Unicode to UTF-8.
